intro: Piptatherum sinaicum, commonly known as the Sinai grass, is a flowering plant species native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Due to its resilience, it is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats.
